attributes.comment:
Please do not consider raising the fees involved in Immigration Benefit
Application/Petition and Biometric Fee Schedule. My husband and I are United
States citizens - multi generational Floridians, born and raised ini Florida.
Because of the cumbersome and daunting adoption rules in the USA, we decided to
adopt internationally, through China. China has a wonderful adoption program
that looks favorably upon foreign adoptions. Unfortunately, the entire process
takes a long time and the USCIS I-171H has an expiration date that renders the
form useless BEFORE the adoption can take place. This means we have to get
fingerprinted again and get another I-171H before we travel. So, not only do we
have to pay these very high fees once, we have to pay them TWICE because the
form and the fingerprints usually expire before families can travel to get their
babies.

The price of adoption is high enough already. We are not rich. We are working
US Citizens who are working very hard and saving every dime we make to have
enough money to have a family. Please do not raise these rates that are already
too high.

A possible solution to raising the rates would be to extend the life of the
I-171H document. If the life of the document was longer, USCIS workers would
not have to process as many documents (it would cut their workload in half for
each family/adoption from China).

Please reconsider this terrible increase. Thank you for allowing me to comment.
Please feel free to contact me to discuss this further.

Sheryl Graham
Key West, FL.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Sheryl L. Graham
